brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate a smart phone-based application ("app") designed to inform pregnant women ages 15-25 about their contraception options. The goal of this research will be to evaluate the usability, feasibility and acceptability of this app.

detailed_description.textblock: This study will evaluate a smart phone-based application ("app") designed to inform pregnant women ages 15-25 about their contraception options. The goal of this research will be to evaluate the usability, feasibility and acceptability of this app. Participants will be asked to complete a survey after informed consent and before using the app. After using the app, participants will complete a second survey. This second survey will ask questions about the app including the following topics: Usability, user-friendliness, navigation, user interface, time spent, organization readability; Feasibility, informative, helpful, comprehensible, quality of art, interface, sound; and Acceptability breadth of content, depth of content, engaging and motivating, Innovative utility and value. Women will also rate the degree to which they promote use of the product: would use the app if available, believe the app will support contraceptive use and would recommend the app to peers. Study participation will end once participants are done with the second survey.

primary_outcome.description: Feasibility, acceptability and usability of application

secondary_outcome.description: Methods of birth control participants have ever used
Previous miscarriages, abortions, times pregnant and children participants have
9 questions asking participants about knowledge of different contraception methods
14 questions asking about how active a role participants have taken in determining their health care.
15 questions asking participants about the information, motivation, and behavioral skills they possess relating to spacing pregnancies by 18 months or longer.

intervention.description: This is a theory-based smart phone-based application designed to provide immediate postpartum contraception information to young women aged 15-25.

study_pop.textblock: -Recruitment will occur at local primary care clinics.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant
- Identify as African American or Black
- English as primary language
Exclusion Criteria:
- Not pregnant
- Not identifying as African American or Black
- Language other than English as primary language
